details.title: Limitations of a Variance Approximation
details.abstract: A common approximation for the variance of a function of two random variables is obtained via a series expansion. It is shown that for some cases the error in the approximation is quite large. This approximation is sometimes used to compare the relative merits of two alternate systems. The comparison might be erroneous if the system differences are comparable to the approximation errors.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
